title: Dual-Task Training Design Based on Medical Simulation

context.prior_knowledge: Expert-level knowledge and experience in solving complex problems
context.additional_context: Training program for pre-service teachers to enhance multitasking abilities in medical simulation environments

learning_goals: Learners can analyze training effectiveness using cognitive load measurement tools (SRME, SDR, RRT) in dual-task simulation environments
Learners can compare and explain cognitive load patterns observed during the transition from novice to expert
Learners can quantitatively evaluate improvements in cognitive efficiency during dual-task performance through repeated training
Learners can establish optimal difficulty-adjustment strategies applying cognitive load theory when designing simulation-based training
difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
